articles.content:
Struggle of S. Korean workers supported
   Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- The Amnesty International on April 23 issued a statement supporting  strikes of the South Korean workers, including Seoul Subway unionists, the South Korean newspaper Hangyore said.   The Amnesty International in the statement issued to the press of South Korea called attention to the fact that warrants of arrest were issued for tens of leading unionists, including those who spearhead strikes, and asserted that workers  have a right to strike against "government" policies harmful to economic and social rights and that arrest of workers for the exercise of such a right stands to no reason.   The statement warned that in case police is called out to put down strikes, it will develop into a violent conflict, and urged the authorities to stop such suppression.

articles.content:
2nd phase of general strike threatened
    Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA)-- The South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally in Seoul on Saturday in demand of the withdrawal of the South Korean authorities' plan to hurl "government forces" to put down the strike of the Subway Workers Unions, according to a radio report from Seoul.   
   The organization declared that it would enter into the 2nd phase of the general strike from the next week if the authorities keep mobilizing "government forces" to crack down upon their strike, refusing to meet its demands.
   At least 20,000 workers belonging to the "National Federation of Bank Worker's Unions" held a meeting in Seoul in demand of stop to the authority's unilateral "restructuring".
   More than 2,000 people including the unemployed and the poor in the city held a rally of jobless people in Seoul that day.

articles.title: Floral baskets laid before Kim Il Sung's statues
Wreaths and floral baskets presented on Army Day
articles.content:
Floral baskets laid before Kim Il Sung's statues
   Pyongyang, April 25 (KCNA) -- Servicemen and working people laid floral baskets before the statue of the President Kim Il Sung on Mansu  Hll today on the occasion of the  67th anniversary of the foundation of the Korean People's Army.   Standing before the statue was a floral basket sent by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   Floral baskets, bouquets and flowers were laid before the statue in the name of party organizations, power organs, institutions of people's armed forces, national institutions, industrial establishments, schools and families.
   Meanwhile, floral baskets, bouquets and flowers were laid before his statues in Pyongyang and other parts of the country.
